Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Vase
Description: Cylindrical vase with straight rim and walls, a well-marked lower curvature and a slightly convex base. Paste of a very well settled off-white colour. Surface covered with a light ochre coating of great quality. It has a painted decoration arranged in a frieze which is delimited by two black trims at the rim and at the base. Between these, a wavy tendril appears, out of which alternating tendrils and bunches of grapes emerge. Acanthus leaves are also to be observed, placed next to the central motif. All designs are outlined in black and painted in different colours on the inside.
